action.action-desc: Mr. Pearce introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To establish a monument in Dona Ana County, New Mexico, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Organ Mountains National Monument Establishment Act .
For the purposes of this Act:

paragraph.text: The term City means the city of Las Cruces, New Mexico.
The term County means Dona Ana County, New Mexico.
The term management plan means the management plan developed pursuant to this Act.
The term map means the map titled Organ Mountains National Monument and dated February 6, 2013.
The term monument means the national monument established by this Act.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Director of the Bureau of Land Management.
The term State Director means the New Mexico State Director of the Bureau of Land Management.
The term State means the State of New Mexico.
constitute or be construed to constitute either an express or implied reservation by the United States of any water or water rights with respect to the lands within the monument; or
affect any water rights existing on the date of the enactment of this Act, including any water right held by the United States.

subsection.text: There is established the Organ Mountains monument in the State.
The monument shall consist of approximately 54,800 acres of public land in Dona Ana County in the State, as generally depicted on the map.

section.text: The purposes of the monument are to conserve, protect, and enhance the cultural, traditional, archaeological, natural, ecological, geological, historical, wildlife, livestock, watershed, educational, recreational, and scenic resources of the monument for the benefit and enjoyment of present and future generations.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall manage the monument—

paragraph.text: in a manner that conserves, protects, and enhances the resources of the monument; and
in accordance with—
The Secretary shall allow only such uses of the monument that the Secretary determines would further the purposes described in section 5.

Except as needed for administrative purposes or to respond to an emergency, the use of motorized vehicles in the monument shall be permitted only on roads designated for use by motorized vehicles in the management plan. Nothing in this Act precludes the use of motorized vehicles or mechanical equipment for the construction or maintenance of range improvements or the performance of standard ranching operations or for the construction, maintenance, operation, or management of flood control or water conservation systems.

No additional road shall be built within the monument after the date of the enactment of this Act unless the Secretary determines that the road is necessary for public safety or natural resource protection.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall issue any grazing leases or permits in the monument in accordance with the same laws and executive orders that apply to issuance by the Secretary of grazing leases and permits on other land under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Land Management.

Nothing in this section precludes the Secretary from authorizing, renewing or upgrading (including widening) a utility right-of-way through the monument in a manner that minimizes harm to the purposes of the monument in accordance with—

paragraph.text: any other applicable law; and
such terms and conditions as the Secretary determines to be appropriate.

subsection.text: Not later than 3 years after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall develop a management plan for the monument.
The management plan shall be developed in consultation with—

paragraph.text: State, tribal, and local governments;
the public; and
interested Federal agencies.
As soon as practicable after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall file the map and legal description of the monument.
The map and legal description filed under paragraph (1) shall have the same force and effect as if included in this Act, except that the Secretary may correct errors in the map and legal description.
The map and legal description filed under paragraph (1) shall be on file and available for public inspection in the appropriate offices of—

subparagraph.text: the Bureau of Land Management; and
the Office of the County Clerk of Dona Ana County, New Mexico.

paragraph.text: Nothing in this Act affects the jurisdiction of the State with respect to fish and wildlife located on public land in the State.

subparagraph.text: There shall be no buffer zone around a monument.

The fact that an activity or use of land is not permitted on land within a monument shall not preclude the activity or use outside the boundary of the monument or on private or State land within the monument, consistent with other applicable laws.

paragraph.text: Subject to valid existing rights (including lease rights), all Federal land within the monument and any land and interests in land acquired for the monument by the United States after the date of the enactment of this Act are withdrawn from—

subparagraph.text: all forms of entry, appropriation, or disposal under the public land laws;
location, entry, and patent under the mining laws; and
operation of the mineral leasing, mineral materials, and geothermal leasing laws.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall allow hunting and trapping in the monument.

paragraph.text: The Secretary may designate by regulation areas in the monument in which, and establish periods during which no hunting or trapping will be allowed for reasons of public safety, administration, or compliance with applicable laws.
The Secretary shall obtain the concurrence of the appropriate State agency before promulgating regulations under paragraph (1) that close a portion of the monument to hunting or trapping.

section.text: For purposes of section 603 of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 (43 U.S.C. 1782), the Federal land in the following has been adequately studied for wilderness designation and shall no longer be subject to section 603(c) of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 (43 U.S.C. 1782(c)):

paragraph.text: The Organ Mountains Wilderness Study Area.
The Organ Needles Wilderness Study Area.
The Pena Blanca Wilderness Study Area.

section.text: Nothing in this Act, or regulations issued in furtherance of this Act, shall prevent Federal, State, or local law enforcement personnel from having unfettered access to the entire monument, including the use of motorized vehicles and specialized equipment.
The monument designated by this Act shall be administered as a component of the National Landscape Conservation System.
